lead_paragraph: The Tampa Bay Rays bolstered their infield depth, signing second baseman Adam Kennedy to a minor league contract. Kennedy was released by St. Louis last week, leaving the Cardinals’ starting job up for grabs heading into spring training. He was scheduled to make $4 million this season, but the Rays would have to pay him only the major league minimum $400,000 if he makes the team.
